data.title: Retina Support + misc. other changes
data.body:
OK, looks like no real changes are needed to support Retina devices. We can add an option to IOSApplicationConfiguration in the future to allow someone to take full advantage of Retina. For now, Retina devices simply return the same dimensions (called "points" not "pixels") as the non-Retina displays. On retina devices 1 point = 2 pixels (non retina: 1 point = 1 pixel).

Here are the changes:
1) getDensity() + getPPI() implemented (via help from Wikipedia)
2) build-natives.sh fixed (no ARM6 anymore!)
3) ALL convert.xml updated (use env.IVKM_HOME now)
4) all 3 demo projects updated: 2 of them working, for vectorpinpall I get the following error: "Warning: The referenced library 'gdx-backend-ios.dll' is not used from any code, skipping extraction of content resources. (gdx-vectorpinball-ios)" - I couldn't figure out what's wrong?
5) IOSApplicationConfiguration has now config options for LANDSCAPE/PORTRAIT

In any case, that completes your requests for iOS :)  I'll look over missing stuff in the iOS backend. Looks like properties is missing for example. Otherwise, I think it's pretty much ready to go besides the build scripts. It's going to be a pain to setup. Maybe I look into that? Anything special planned for the build scripts to make them easy to use (for others)?

data.title: iOS: LANDSCAPE + Sound + Music Feature Complete (/w Limitations)
data.body:
UPDATE 2012-09-27: (new!)

OK, I updated libgdx iOS to support screen orientation changes. Both PORTRAIT + LANDSCAPE are supported.

Changes:
- IOApplication code updated
- Invaders: converted OGG->WAV + a minor bugfix to prevent Music from being disposed

Limitations: for some reason you cannot do PORTRAIT + LANDSCAPE at the same time. The screen rotates but the resulting scale is off. Right now you can do PORTRAIT/PORTRAIT_UPSIDEDOWN -or- LANDSCAPE_LEFT/LANDSCAPE_RIGHT. Mixing PORTRAIT and LANDSCAPE doesn't seem to work right!? This has been tested with the "invaders" demo - "invaders" works now in LANDSCAPE :)   Tested on Tropical Stormfront too and working.

---

UPDATE 2012-09-26:

I managed to complete Sound and Music for iOS. I have tested with superjumper and Tropical Stormfront (got Tropical Stormfront to run :-).

Here are the changes:
- IOS Audio classes updated
- Converted the superjumper OGG files to WAV.
- Bugfix: FPS counter was wrong (IOSGraphics)

Please note the implementation supports WAV & MP3 (no OGG - sorry!). There is no "pitch" functionality for IOSSound (should be there but not in Mono!?). The rest should be to specs.

I will do some testing on an actual device to make sure it's working. I noted some slowness with Tropical Stormfront but I am not sure if it is caused by the sound? superjumper was running smooth.

data.title: Fixed javadoc for some methods (#982).
data.body: The topic pretty much says it all. :-)

data.title: Useful methods for VertexAttributes class
data.body: Just added some useful methods to VertexAttributes class to find VertexAttribute for a specified usage and its offset.

data.title: Initial version with Sound + Music
data.body:
Hi guys, this is Chris - you probably don't know me :)   In any case, it's not much but I spent some time to get familiar with libgdx on iOS. I created an update with support for Sound + Music. I tested it with SuperJumper and was successfully able to play the Music in the iPhone simulator.

It's far from done, but I figured I'll go ahead and post it so not several people are working on the same without knowing it.

Here are the limitations:
- no .ogg file support; works with mp3 and should also work with wav files
- no looping yet (need to register some delegates first)
- no soundIds yet for IOSound.java - needs more work but definitely doable

I am aware OpenAL was suggested. The files I checked in use AVAudioPlayer. I can implement it all using AVAudioPlayer the only drawback is there will be no .ogg support (is there some sort of converter for .ogg to WAV/MP3?). iOS only likes to play with either WAV or MP3 files.

If we agree to defer .ogg support to later I would be able to wrap this up within the next 2 weeks (or earlier). Worry about .ogg/OpenAL later? Comments?

Thanks
Chris

EDIT: Also, I wasn't so clear on error handling (not being able to load the audio). I guess I'll have to log an error and return null? I'll read the interface documentations for Audio.java - Sorry!

data.title: Some lwjgl refactoring
data.body: Fixed code formatting, added protected for coherency and replaced java.util.List.

data.title: Methods to get all file names in the AssetManager and to get all dependencies a asset might have
data.body:
I've added 2 methods to retrieve the keys of all loaded assets and to get all dependencies they might have. This makes it easier to debug and to analyze assets.

I still have once concern since the method `toArray()`creates a new Array every time you get the keys. I don't think a developer will call this every frame. A solution would be to use the `iterator` the `Keys`class already is.

data.title: Added bullet motionstate director
data.body:
Added the director to the btMotionState swig interface. After running swig and compiling the motionstate can be used to receive updates from bullet.

Note: I'm not experienced using git, please check if everything went well before pulling the change.

data.title: OpenCTM model loader
data.body:
hi I quickly implemented a model loader for the OpenCTM file format. I did it using a lib I created a while back ( [JOpenCTM](http://github.com/Danny02/JOpenCTM) ).

I don't know how you handle such things, so I just put the compiled lib into the a new libs folder(I used the "version_1.0" tag of the lib).

So if you have something I need to change first, jsut let me know.

PS: I have some critice on the API design here and there and would like to discuss some of them, where would be the best place to do this?

data.title: Fix FreeType crashes (issue #768)
data.body:
This should solve issue #768 (http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=768) where loading a font would work on the phone but crash when running on the desktop.
- A new build of gdx-freetype.dll with a non-buggy compiler should fix the desktop crashes
- The last patch commit should fix crashes with CheckJNI turned on (default on emulators it seems)
- Updating to FreeType 2.4.10 because it can't hurt and a new build is required anyway

data.title: Added cone and filled cone to ShapeRenderer
Fix for MD5 tokenizer bug
data.body: Replaced the StringTokenizer with a regex matcher to support quoted strings with spaces

data.title: Use accessor methods in Button#draw and TextButton#draw
data.body:
I wanted to disable the isOver style for a single TextButton. The easiest way seems to be by overwriting #isOver to always return false. However this was ignored in #draw.

Even if this is not the preferred usage there is currently some inconsistency in using either the private field or the accessor, or the accessor of the clicklistener.

data.title: Fixed Decal setRotation.
data.body: Changed due to fix in Quaternion#setFromAxis.

data.title: JSON serializing in the particle editor
data.body:
Disclaimer: This is a best effort expansion, so please discard the request if it s useless/done entierly wrong. :-P 

You should inspect the request, and check if there are any other fields that should be transient. At the moment it can serialize both the standard text format, and json-files. By removing backward compatibility a lot of code can be discarded,.

data.title: Changed build templates to skip a native build if the necessary compiler is missing
data.body: Modifications to the native build templates that will allow the build process to skip any build that depends on a compiler that isn't present on the system. These are just the changed template files, not the changed build files that are generated as a result of running the GdxBuild (and related) scripts.  We'll see if the build server blows up?

data.title: Changed native lib build files to skip a build if the necessary compiler is missing
data.body:
The native libraries have their own build.xml files for each platform (Windows 64, Windows 32, Linux 32, etc.)  When I tried to run the native lib build using:

ant -Denv.NDK_HOME=/opt/android-ndk-r8b -Dbuild-natives=true

the build failed when it reached a compiler I didn't have available/configured to cross-compile on my machine.

What I decided to do was to change all the native lib build files to check for the existence of the compiler (i586-mingw32msvc-gcc, etc.) and to skip that particular part of the build if it couldn't find that compiler on the system.  This shouldn't cause problems for systems that have a compiler configured, but should just avoid unnecessary failures when trying to build for only a particular platform.  It seems like a good idea to me, but I'm completely new to libgdx (just finding my way) so may be missing some particular nuance of the build. Fwiw, thought I'd pass it back upstream for review.

I also made some minor formatting tweaks in the build files' XML (removed unusual formatting in the XML just out of habit -- sorry that pollutes the patch a bit).  Overall, it's the same pattern applied to each of the native/jni build files.

data.title: Added gitignore entry for libgdx-*.zip instead of just libgdx-nightlies.zip
data.body: I'm just getting started with libgdx, but I notice zips with version numbers are not included in the project's gitignore (the nightlies are, though).  Seems you'd want all build products/zips to be in gitignore?  Feel free to disregard if not...

data.title: ScrollPane, fixed fling scroll
data.body: Bug after 9c0979aef4ac275fb135fd59e3c0a5c3f0a64502

data.title: Refactored OgreXmlLoader and SubMesh
data.body:
The current loader does not support shared geometry and requires a skeleton file to be loaded at all times. I changed it so that a StillModel is returned in case there is no skeleton. In order to do that I need to do move some things around. I think I managed to improve a bit the overall structure of the SubMesh classes, but my Java is a bit rusty, so beware of possible consequences.
I fixed as well a small path in SkeletonModelViewer.

Feel free to change whatever you think is not OK. Otherwise, let me know and I can rework it a bit in order to better fit the project philosophy.

data.title: Added configuration property to set assets output folder in gwt backend.
data.body:
I'm using maven conventions in my project and in the gwt backend I needed the assets to be copied to "src/main/webapp/" instead of "war/", so I added a configuration property (just like "gdx.assetpath") to control this target folder. If the property is not set, it uses "war/" by default.

I made a custom build with the patch and it's working in my project.

I hope it helps!

Commit message:
Added "assetoutputpath" configuration property to gwt backend to control the folder where resources are copied. To use it <set-configuration-property name="gdx.assetoutputpath" value="whatever/relative/path/" /> must be added in the main GWT module of the game.
If the property is not set, it uses "war/" folder by default to output the assets.

data.title: Added a null check for the stage of the scrollpane, in case that stage has been removed
data.body: The issue can be reproduced by having a scollpane within a Table, and (while flinging the scrollpane up/down) replace the contents of that table with some other stuff (table.clear()). The scrollpane reference to its stage in cancelTouchFocusedChild will then be 'null', and an exception will emerge.

data.title: The comparison should include the extreme limits rather than exclude them
data.body: Else [bad things](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/commit/ab507d723e9003558092d0ebf383f79fe7bef355#commitcomment-1777674) can happen to both the indices and the atlas :)

data.title: Enables Hiero to keep track of the last used paths, glyphs and filenames
data.body:
This is done on a per-action basis so that each type of directory is
stored/restored separately: the actual Preferences instance is being
used to store this information persistently.

Also keeps track of the last filename used to export .hiero/.fnt files: the
first time the save dialog is opened, a filename is suggested.

data.title: Enables Hiero to keep track of the last used paths + missing @Override annotations
data.body: This is done on a per-action basis so that each type of directory is stored/restored separately: the actual Preferences instance is being used to store this information persistently.

data.title: More concise .gitignore
data.body:
This should satisfy the same needs as the actual .gitignore, it's just shorter.

Please ignore this if the idea was to BE verbose.

data.title: Enables Hiero tool to read effect values again when loading a .hiero file
data.body: For some reason the code was commented out, but after trying a few save/loads everything seems to work fine. Also, a simple blame shown some commits, but i found issue [#804](http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=804) on Google Code, this describes the same problem and the same solution :)

data.title: Added optional methods to ShaderProgram to set uniforms and attribute locations using the location.
data.body: Just added optional methods to ShaderProgram to set uniforms and attribute locations using the location. They were copy/pasted instead reusing logic to avoid adding more internal method calls, don't know how frequently are they called.

data.title: Add missing import for SkeletonModel loading.
data.body: Just noticed it.

data.title: Box2D changes to SetTransform() to avoid multiple internal calls to FindNewContact()
data.body:
As explained in this Box2D forum thread http://box2d.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=8757 this pull request was made to try to minimize the cost of Body->SetTransform() by adding a new SetTransform() method with an optional parameter to avoid triggering internal FindNewContacts(). 

Hope you can take a look. Btw, I believe generated cpp/h could be removed from git by adding a new ant task to run the GdxBuild with the proper parameters, and to avoid uploading generated code multiple times.
